## Description {#details}

This file defines the main interface for hardware event listeners.

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Number of physical register allocated for this instruction. There is one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// entry per register file.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/hwinstructiondispatchedevent/#a6a118e663189ddd1479a228ecf31a883"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/hwinstructiondispatchedevent/#a6a118e663189ddd1479a228ecf31a883">UsedPhysRegs</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Number of micro opcodes dispatched.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This field is often set to the total number of micro-opcodes specified by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the instruction descriptor of IR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The only exception is when IR declares a number of micro opcodes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which exceeds the processor DispatchWidth, and - by construction - it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// requires multiple cycles to be fully dispatched. In that particular case,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the dispatch logic would generate more than one dispatch event (one per</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cycle), and each event would declare how many micro opcodes are effectively</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// been dispatched to the schedulers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/hwinstructiondispatchedevent/#a221e4b57bdb6000f98ebff74d1d073ba"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/hwinstructiondispatchedevent/#a221e4b57bdb6000f98ebff74d1d073ba">MicroOpcodes</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
